intro: Rhombospora commersonii, commonly known as the Commerson's rhombospora, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Pottiaceae. It is a cryptogamic plant characterized by its small, flat, and often wrinkled thallus, which is typically green or yellowish in color. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, such as on rocks or soil in temperate regions. It lacks true roots, stems, and leaves, and instead has a simple structure composed of a single layer of cells. Rhombospora commersonii plays a role in soil stabilization and serves as a habitat for various microorganisms.
